docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 26--Another cruiser, the new 10,000-ton Phoenix, has been ordered to South American waters and is proceeding to Valparaiso, Chile.

docs.snippet: Leopold Stokowski has accepted an invitation from Mayor Thomas D. Taggart Jr. of Atlantic City, N.J., to use the seaside resort for rehearsals of the All-American Youth Orchestra which will embark on the S.S. Uruguay July 26 for its good-will tour of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Leopold Stokowski has accepted an invitation from Mayor Thomas D. Taggart Jr. of Atlantic City, N.J., to use the seaside resort for rehearsals of the All-American Youth Orchestra which will embark on the S.S. Uruguay July 26 for its good-will tour of Latin America.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 27--Reports that Argentina has politely but firmly informed the United States Government that she does not desire the visits of further American warships at this time circulated today in usually well-informed diplomatic quarters...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 27--Reports that Argentina has politely but firmly informed the United States Government that she does not desire the visits of further American warships at this time circulated today in usually well-informed diplomatic quarters here.
docs.abstract: Wash circles hear of Argentine protest against further visits by warships; denial by U S State Dept

headline.main: ARGENTINE PROTEST ON FLEET REPORTED; U.S. Said to Have Been Told Politely That Further Visits by Warships Are Unwelcome SOLIDARITY AIM SET BACK Washington Has Offered Aid to Neighbors in Resisting European Pressure

docs.snippet: As the Administration pushes forward its efforts for closer inter-American relations, the scope of the economic problem needs to be kept clearly in mind.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 27--The Uruguayan authorities last night released ten Nazi leaders who had been in custody for ten days for questioning regarding the recently discovered plot to seize Uruguay as an agricultural colony of the Reich.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 27--The Uruguayan authorities last night released ten Nazi leaders who had been in custody for ten days for questioning regarding the recently discovered plot to seize Uruguay as an agricultural colony of the Reich.

headline.main: URUGUAY RELEASES TEN NAZI SUSPECTS; Pressure to Drop Inquiry Said to Come From a Neighbor as Well as Germany INTERIOR MINISTER QUITS Party's Insistence That He Be Dropped Seen as a Gesture to Placate the Public

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 27--In Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, Germans told this correspondent: "Everything is quiet in Southern Brazil. If you visit our consulates, you will find fifth column rumors false."
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 27--In Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, Germans told this correspondent: "Everything is quiet in Southern Brazil. If you visit our consulates, you will find fifth column rumors false."
docs.abstract: German colonizers taught to preserve racial unity; activities by Consul Gen Reid and others, Porto Alegre and elsewhere; propaganda material and documents seized; wholly Nazified communities reptd
